official_title: Phase III Prospective Randomized Trial of Primary Lung Tumor Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy Followed by Concurrent Mediastinal Chemoradiation for Locally-Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
brief_title: Testing the Addition of High Dose, Targeted Radiation to the Usual Treatment for Locally-Advanced Inoperable Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
cancer_type_display: A study for patients with locally-advanced, inoperable, non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
cancer_tags: Locally Advanced Lung Non-Small Cell Carcinoma
Stage IIB Lung Cancer AJCC v8
Stage III Lung Cancer AJCC v8
prior_treatments_excluded: Prior radiotherapy to the study cancer

key_inclusion_summary: Pathologically proven diagnosis of non-operable stage IIB or III, node positive non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
Primary tumor must be 7 cm or less.
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0-2.
No evidence of distant metastases based on FDG PET/CT scan.
Patient is deemed clinically appropriate for curative intent definitive combined modality therapy.
key_exclusion_summary: Prior radiotherapy to the study cancer.
Patients without an identifiable primary tumor and at least one radiographically-involved lymph node.
Centrally located primary tumor less than 2 cm from involved nodal disease that would result in significant overlap of radiation fields.
Participants who are pregnant or nursing.
Prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment has the potential to interfere with the study.
